intro: Draco perottetii, commonly known as the dragon blood tree, is a unique plant native to the Socotra Archipelago. It is characterized by its distinctive umbrella-shaped crown and thick, leathery leaves. The tree produces a red, resinous sap that has been historically used for medicinal and dye purposes. Its adaptation to arid environments includes a slow growth rate and the ability to store water in its trunk. Botanically, it belongs to the family Dracaenaceae and is known for its striking appearance and ecological significance.
